page.title: 03HOW MALT IS MADE
page.content:
They take the barley which is grown by the farmers and they turn it into malt by soaking it for 56 hours, then grow it for 4 days, then put it in bags for a day and finally cook it. When we went to have a look round, we put our hands in a sack of malt and it was burning hot and sticky. We tasted it too and it wasn't very nice. Malt has more to do with alcohol. They don't have anything to do with hops which gives the bitter taste to beer. Here in Thorpe_le_Soken they make crystal malt. This is a very special sort of malt and there are only six maltings like this in the whole of England. Its a very rare product. 1500 tons of crystal malt is made here every year.
_
